title: Error 7B on macbook while XP.img works fine on VM

forumNotes.author: guylhem
forumNotes.content:
Hello  

I have prepared an XP.img following the instructions posted on <http://reboot.pro/9830/>  

The result works fine in a VM, works fine in a real PC, and works fine when copied on a macbook fixed drive (using syslinux on the MBR : syslinux-\>grub-\>ntldr) using the following menu.lst :  

title XP-1.img - WinVBlock RAMDISK - 1639 MB  
map --mem (hd0,1)/XP-1.img (hd0)  
map --hook  
root (hd0,0)  
chainloader /ntldr  

However, while I can boot fine, on reboot all change to the filesystem are discarded - as if it was a RAM copy of the filesystem.  

Trying to run with the "FILEDISK" option (ie map without --mem) brings a BSOD 7B.  
Trying to install the image to the fixed drive from the RAMDISK option works fine, but then brings a BSOD 7B - even if following every step of the readme.  

/sos ntldr boot flag does not give any clue. I can start in command line just fine. I can't start anything graphical including safe mode, which is offered on reboot since xp detects something is wrong (which lets me think FILEDISK mode can write to the XP-1.img, or it couldn't save the "boot failed" status)  

So far, the only hint I've found is <http://reboot.pro/14130/page__st__150> but it does not look like the same issue. I can edit the registry with chntpw (linux utility). I am just looking for a way to boot and be able to save modifications to the filesystem  

May I ask for any suggestion?
